critique: This executive order pertains to the Civilian Conservation Corps (CCC) during the Great Depression. It amends a previous order regarding pay and allowances for members of the CCC. The order specifies that a certain percentage of members can receive cash allowances based on their performance and leadership. It does not directly address immigration, executive power in a broad sense, federalism, national security vs. civil liberties, or social inclusion. It does have some bearing on economic regulation, as it relates to government spending and wage control, and ideological tilt, as it reflects a government interventionist approach to unemployment during the Depression.
